document_data.name: House Bakr
document_data.mainbody: '''House Bakr''', also called the '''Clan of the Young Camel''', was an [[Zakharan pantheon|enlightened]] desert tribe of [[Al-Badia]] spread across [[west Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p37">
document_data.Base of Operations: In 1367 DR, most of the tribe abandoned their desert life in favor of living in and around the city of [[Tajar]] where their sheikh ruled. Still, some 500 of them preferred to stay true to their ancient ways and remained within the [[High Desert]].<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p37"/>
document_data.Relationship: Many members of House Bakr married into other desert tribes.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p37"/>
document_data.Members: Sheikh [[Ali al-Hadd]] was the leader of the House of Bakr, as well as the city of Tajar, in 1367 DR. [[Ajan al-Yaqud]] led the portion of the tribe living within the High Desert.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p37"/>
